title.line1: Your AI assistant that follows the news
title.line2: and builds your briefing for you

howitworks.subtitle: Add your favorite sources, define your audience, and let the system turn raw headlines into a clean, curated and summarized newsletter.

connect.title: Bring all your sources into one place
connect.description: Sports, technology, science, business, world news‚Ä¶ Instead of jumping between tabs, apps and RSS lists, gather everything into a single clean feed.
connect.step1: Add the websites, blogs and news sources you already follow or choose from ready-made categories like Technology, Science, Sports, Finance and World News.
connect.step2: Set a priority level for each source: 'High priority', 'If relevant', or 'Low priority'. Your feed adapts based on what's important to you.
connect.step3: The system refreshes RSS feeds in the background, filters out duplicates, broken links or outdated entries, and keeps only clean, usable content.
connect.step4: What you get is a single, organized content queue refreshed, deduplicated and ready for summarization.

train.title: Teach your assistant what matters
train.description: Simply interact with the content you enjoy your assistant gradually adapts to your taste and your audience‚Äôs expectations.
train.step1: As you open, save or highlight stories, the system learns which topics and tones you care about.
train.step2: Hide irrelevant or low-quality items; similar stories will appear far less in future briefings.
train.step3: Related stories from different sources are automatically merged into one clean block, instead of five separate links.
train.step4: Each article gets a short, human-readable summary so your readers can understand the big picture in minutes.
train.step5: Over time your briefings turn into a personalized feed tuned to your interests and the level of detail your audience needs.

design.title: Shape your briefing to match your brand
design.description: Choose the tone, structure and identity of your newsletter the system adapts, but the creative direction stays yours.
design.step1: Choose the overall layout: Highlights, Industry Rundown, Deep Dives, Light Content, Editor‚Äôs Note and more reorder sections as you like.
design.step2: In User Settings, define your newsletter name, company name, sender name, sender email, short description and footer details.
design.step3: Pick your default tone: analytical, conversational, concise or storytelling summaries are automatically generated in that style.
design.step4: Describe your brand voice, target audience and industry context; the AI uses this guidance in every generated block.
design.step5: Add personal notes, special announcements or editorial comments to give each issue a human, authentic touch.

automate.title: Automate sending and forget the schedule
automate.description: Set it once the system collects, summarizes and prepares content, then sends it at the right time.
automate.step1: Choose sending frequency: daily, weekly or weekdays only. The system gathers content accordingly.
automate.step2: Set a delivery time; the newsletter is prepared automatically before that moment.
automate.step3: Enable auto-send or manually review each issue before sending the choice is yours.
automate.step4: Every sent issue is logged with recipient, timestamp and status information for easy tracking.
automate.step5: Browse your sending history to see which rhythm works best and fine-tune your content flow over time.

faqs.question: What's the difference between Starter and Pro?
faqs.answer: Starter includes basic limits; Pro unlocks unlimited feeds, advanced AI summaries, automation, and premium features.

faqs.question: Can I switch plans later?
faqs.answer: Yes ‚Äî you can upgrade or downgrade anytime. Upgrades take effect immediately.

faqs.question: Do you lock me into a contract?
faqs.answer: No. All plans are month-to-month with no long-term commitments.

faqs.question: What happens if I hit my Starter limits?
faqs.answer: You'll be prompted to upgrade. Your data is never deleted or throttled.
